intro: Xylanthemum paleaceum, commonly known as the paleaceum xylanthemum, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
